text: when breakable objects meet solid
surfaces you usually get destruction but
when those objects meet water you get
fluid dynamics in action fluid dynamics
also apply to gelatin gelatin is called
an amorphous solid that means it behaves
like a solid and the liquid so how will
the gelatin react when it hits glass
will it form a gooey blob break into a
thousand tiny pieces or bouncing resume
its normal shape see gelatin bounces and
regains its shape the bounce is called
elastic deformation that's the liquid
reaction but did you see those small
breakaway fragments that's called
plastic deformation and that's a solid
reaction so next time you drop something
and it smashes don't feel bad think of
it as sort of a spontaneous science
experiment
